intro: Thapsia annua, commonly known as the annual thapsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Thapsia annua is an annual herb that is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa.
